data.title: Novosibirsk weather and climate in 2024
data.text:
Weather overview

Novosibirsk, the heart of Siberia, experiences a continental climate, marked by a stark contrast between the cold, frosty winters and the warm, verdant summers. The mercury plunges to chilly lows averaging -20Â Â°CÂ (-4Â Â°F) in January, but it can climb to cozy highs of 26Â Â°CÂ (78Â Â°F) during the blissful July days. The onset of precipitation heightens in June, with rainfall reaching 60Â mmÂ (2.36Â in), while the crispy Siberian air is driest in February at only 17Â mmÂ (0.65Â in) of rain. Despite the frigid winters, Novosibirsk basks in sunshine as the long summer days peak with upwards of 10Â hours of sunlight in June.

January weather

January braces for the pinnacle of Siberian winter with a bracing average high of -11Â Â°CÂ (12Â Â°F) in Novosibirsk. The city is shrouded in bleak winter twilight, offering a meager 2Â hours of sun. Winter coats and warm boots are essential as the winter breath lingers with an average wind speed of 4Â m/s and rainfall insignificant at 32Â mmÂ (1.25Â in).

February weather

February sees the persistence of winter, albeit slightly milder, with daytime highs reaching around -8Â Â°CÂ (17Â Â°F). The icy grip tightens with almost 7Â days classified as wet, cushioned by the soft fall of 17Â mmÂ (0.65Â in) snowy blankets. Novosibirsk's wind still carries a bite with an average speed of 4Â m/s.

March weather

March heralds the transition with day temperatures slowly creeping up to -1Â Â°CÂ (31Â Â°F). The snow starts to recede, yet 7Â days of rain indicates winter's reluctance to release its hold fully. While gusts of cold wind average 4Â m/s, the sun begins to thaw the frosted landscape with an average 6Â hours.

April weather

April bestows a breath of fresh air with the mercury ascending to a pleasant 8Â Â°CÂ (46Â Â°F). Rain showers sprinkle across Novosibirsk, with up to 7Â days of precipitation and 28Â mmÂ (1.12Â in) falling softly. A brisk breeze flows at 4Â m/s, though the increased sun exposure at 7Â hours hints at warmer days ahead.

May weather

May celebrates the full swing of spring with temperatures soaring to an inviting 18Â Â°CÂ (65Â Â°F). Sunbathing becomes an option as daylight stretches to a sumptuous 9Â hours. The breeze remains gentle at 4Â m/s, and with a peak of 9Â days as wet days, residents are occasionally reminded of the season's capricious nature with 36Â mmÂ (1.40Â in) rainfall.

June weather

Come June, the climate turns welcomingly warm, flirting with highs of 24Â Â°CÂ (74Â Â°F). The longest days of the year bless the city with 10Â hours of sunshine. The atmosphere brews with a moderate humidity of 59Â %, and the whisper of rain on 11Â days suggests a blend of clear skies and occasional showers offering 60Â mmÂ (2.36Â in).

July weather

July stands as the pinnacle of warmth in Novosibirsk, with the mercury peaking at an average high of 26Â Â°CÂ (78Â Â°F). With 11Â days of wet weather, there's a persistent chance of rain amounting to 69Â mmÂ (2.73Â in). Pleasant breezes at 3Â m/s accompany the hearty 10Â hours of sun, crafting ideal conditions for midsummer celebrations.

August weather

August sees the waning of the fiery Siberian summer, as daylight recedes slightly to 8Â hours, with temperatures holding a comfortable 23Â Â°CÂ (73Â Â°F) during the day. Showers dot the landscape on approximately 10Â days, depositing a generous 58Â mmÂ (2.28Â in) of rain, supported by a subtle 3Â m/s breeze.

September weather

September brings the first whispers of autumn to Novosibirsk, draping the city in an array of amber and gold. The average high temperature hovers at 16Â Â°CÂ (61Â Â°F), while the shortening days offer a decent 6Â hours of sunlight. Gentle winds maintain a speed of 3Â m/s amid the intermittent patter of rain across 9Â days, cumulatively pouring 45Â mmÂ (1.76Â in).

October weather

October's curtain falls with a chill as temperatures drop to a crisp 8Â Â°CÂ (46Â Â°F). Dramatic clouds sail the sky, washing the city on about 11Â days, with a moderate downpour of 44Â mmÂ (1.71Â in). A fresh gust averaging 4Â m/s conducts the symphony of fallen leaves, while daylight dwindles to a scant 3Â hours.

November weather

November arrives with a premonition of winter, daytime temperatures plunging to -4Â Â°CÂ (26Â Â°F). The city experiences a dwindling 2Â hours of sunlight, and while the wind strengthens to 4Â m/s, the expected precipitation of 36Â mmÂ (1.40Â in) brings snow flurries that start to blanket the region.

December weather

December deepens the winter's tale in Novosibirsk with a bitterly cold narrative. Frosty highs reach just -9Â Â°CÂ (15Â Â°F) and the city huddles under scant 2Â hours of daylight. Encroaching darkness broods over 11Â days of inclement weather, whilst the persistent humidity of 98Â % grips the air with a palpable chill.
